<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// supported by the CPU.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Size examples:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Type        SizeInBits  StoreSizeInBits  AllocSizeInBits&#91;&#42;&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ----        ----------  ---------------  ---------------</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  i1            1           8                8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  i8            8           8                8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  i19          19          24               32</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  i32          32          32               32</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  i100        100         104              128</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  i128        128         128              128</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  Float        32          32               32</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  Double       64          64               64</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  X86&#95;FP80     80          80               96</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#91;&#42;&#93; The alloc size depends on the alignment, and thus on the target.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     These values are for x86-32 linux.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the number of bits necessary to hold the specified type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For example, returns 36 for i36 and 80 for x86&#95;fp80. The type passed must</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// have a size (Type::isSized() must return true).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#acf0b1898efd7f81a078e9288befd9290">getTypeSizeInBits</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the maximum number of bytes that may be overwritten by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// storing the specified type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For example, returns 5 for i36 and 10 for x86&#95;fp80.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#acfcd22eb38dbfe1acbf138754297437a"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#acfcd22eb38dbfe1acbf138754297437a">getTypeStoreSize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the maximum number of bits that may be overwritten by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// storing the specified type; always a multiple of 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#a04cbf0d1549609eeea73a0c8904b2dbf"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#a04cbf0d1549609eeea73a0c8904b2dbf">typeSizeEqualsStoreSize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the offset in bytes between successive objects of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// specified type, including alignment padding.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is the amount that alloca reserves for this type. For example,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// returns 12 or 16 for x86&#95;fp80, depending on alignment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
